modelIdentification.name: SISO-STD-001.1-2015 - Real-time Platform Reference Communication FOM Module
modelIdentification.purpose: The RPR FOM supports interoperability for real-time, platform oriented defense simulation.
modelIdentification.description: The Communication module is used to simulate radio transmitters and receivers as well as the radio signals that are transmitted between them.

reference.identification: Real-time Platform Reference Base FOM Module
Standard for Guidance, Rationale, and Interoperability Modalities for the Real-time Platform Reference Federation Object Model (RPR FOM) SISO-STD-001-2015 10 August 2015
IEEE Standard for Distributed Interactive Simulation - Application Protocols IEEE Std 1278.1-1995 September 21, 1995
IEEE Standard for Distributed Interactive Simulation - Application Protocols IEEE Std 1278.1a-1998 19 March 1998

objectClass.name: RadioTransmitter
objectClass.semantics: A device that sends out information encoded in electromagnetic waves in the radio frequency range.

attribute.name: AntennaPatternData
attribute.semantics: The radiation pattern of the radio's antenna.

attribute.name: CryptographicMode
attribute.semantics: The mode of the cryptographic system.

attribute.name: CryptoSystem
attribute.semantics: The type of cryptographic equipment in use.

attribute.name: EncryptionKeyIdentifier
attribute.semantics: The identification of the key used to encrypt the radio signals being transmitted. The transmitter and receiver should be considered to be using the same key if these numbers match.

attribute.name: Frequency
attribute.semantics: The center frequency of the radio transmissions.

attribute.name: FrequencyBandwidth
attribute.semantics: The bandpass of the radio transmissions.

attribute.name: RadioIndex
attribute.semantics: A number that uniquely identifies this radio from others on the host.

attribute.name: RadioInputSource
attribute.semantics: Specifies which position or data port provided the input for the transmission.

attribute.name: RadioSystemType
attribute.semantics: The type of radio transmitter.

attribute.name: RFModulationSystemType
attribute.semantics: The radio system type associated with this transmitter.

attribute.name: RFModulationType
attribute.semantics: Classification of the modulation type.

attribute.name: SpreadSpectrum
attribute.semantics: Describes the spread spectrum characteristics of the transmission, such as frequency hopping or other spread spectrum transmission modes.

attribute.name: StreamTag
attribute.semantics: A globally unique identifier for the associated audio stream

attribute.name: TimeHopInUse
attribute.semantics: Whether the radio is using time hopping or not.

attribute.name: TransmittedPower
attribute.semantics: The average transmitted power.

attribute.name: TransmitterOperationalStatus
attribute.semantics: The current operational state of the radio transmitter.

attribute.name: WorldLocation
attribute.semantics: The location of the antenna in the world coordinate system.

objectClass.name: RadioReceiver
objectClass.semantics: A device that converts incoming electromagnetic waves in the radio frequency range into information.

attribute.name: RadioIndex
attribute.semantics: A number that uniquely identifies this radio receiver from other receivers on the host object.

attribute.name: ReceivedPower
attribute.semantics: The radio frequency power received, after applying any propagation loss and antenna gain.

attribute.name: ReceivedTransmitterIdentifier
attribute.semantics: The object instance ID of the transmitter that generated the received radio signal.

attribute.name: ReceiverOperationalStatus
attribute.semantics: The operational state of the radio receiver.

interactionClass.name: RadioSignal
interactionClass.semantics: The wireless transmission and reception of audio or digital data by means of electromagnetic waves.

interactionClass.name: EncodedAudioRadioSignal
interactionClass.semantics: A radio signal used to transmit voice/audio data encoded according to a standard encoding scheme.

parameter.name: AudioData
parameter.semantics: The data associated with the encoded audio radio signal

interactionClass.name: RawBinaryRadioSignal
interactionClass.semantics: A radio signal used to transmit raw binary data.

parameter.name: HostRadioIndex
parameter.semantics: The object instance ID of the radio transmitting this signal.

parameter.name: DataRate
parameter.semantics: The rate at which the data is being transmitted.

parameter.name: SignalDataLength
parameter.semantics: The length of the signal data.

parameter.name: SignalData
parameter.semantics: The signal data.

parameter.name: TacticalDataLinkType
parameter.semantics: The type of tactical data link used to transmitted this signal (if any).

parameter.name: TDLMessageCount
parameter.semantics: The number of tactical data link messages contained in this signal.

interactionClass.name: DatabaseIndexRadioSignal
interactionClass.semantics: A radio signal that represents transmission of a pre-determined message by using a pre-defined database index.

parameter.name: HostRadioIndex
parameter.semantics: The object instance ID of the radio transmitting this signal.

parameter.name: DatabaseIndex
parameter.semantics: The index into the federation specific database of stored signals.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: The duration of the stored signal to be replayed.

parameter.name: StartOffset
parameter.semantics: The offset, from the start of the stored signal, that the signal is replayed from.

parameter.name: TacticalDataLinkType
parameter.semantics: The type of tactical data link used to transmitted this signal (if any).

parameter.name: TDLMessageCount
parameter.semantics: The number of tactical data link messages contained in this signal.

interactionClass.name: ApplicationSpecificRadioSignal
interactionClass.semantics: A radio signal that can be used for an application specific encoding scheme.

parameter.name: HostRadioIndex
parameter.semantics: The object instance ID of the radio transmitting this signal.

parameter.name: DataRate
parameter.semantics: The rate at which the data is being transmitted.

parameter.name: SignalDataLength
parameter.semantics: The length of the signal data.

parameter.name: SignalData
parameter.semantics: The signal data.

parameter.name: TacticalDataLinkType
parameter.semantics: The type of tactical data link used to transmitted this signal (if any).

parameter.name: TDLMessageCount
parameter.semantics: The number of tactical data link messages contained in this signal.

parameter.name: UserProtocolID
parameter.semantics: The ID of the user protocol in use.

simpleData.name: BitRateBitPerSecondUnsignedInteger32
simpleData.semantics: Rate of transmission, in bits per second.

simpleData.name: BitsUnsignedInteger16
simpleData.semantics: Transmission size, in number of bits.

simpleData.name: FrequencyHertzUnsignedInteger64
simpleData.semantics: Frequency of a radio transmission, in hertz.

enumeratedData.name: CryptographicModeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Represents the encryption mode of a cryptographic system.

arrayData.name: AntennaPatternVariantStructLengthlessArray
arrayData.semantics: Represents an antenna's radiation pattern, its orientation in space, and the polarization of the radiation.

arrayData.name: CoefficientsLengthlessArray1Plus
arrayData.semantics: Represents the power distribution from the antenna as the coefficients of a spherical harmonic expansion. The highest order of the expansion can be determined by the number of coefficients in the array.

arrayData.name: SignalDataLengthlessArray1Plus
arrayData.semantics: The audio or digital data conveyed in a radio transmission.

fixedRecordData.name: AudioDataTypeStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Specifies an encoded audio radio signal.

field.name: StreamTag
field.semantics: Identifier for the audio stream. This must be globally unique.

field.name: EncodingType
field.semantics: The type of encoding used for the audio data

field.name: SampleRate
field.semantics: The number of samples per second in the audio data.

field.name: DataLength
field.semantics: The length of the signal data.

field.name: SampleCount
field.semantics: The number of samples in this transmission.

field.name: Data
field.semantics: The signal data.

fixedRecordData.name: BeamAntennaStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Specifies the direction, pattern, and polarization of radiation from a radio transmitter's antenna.

field.name: BeamOrientation
field.semantics: The rotation that transforms the reference coordinate system into the beam coordinate system.

field.name: BeamAzimuthBeamwidth
field.semantics: The full width of the beam to the -3 dB power density points in the x-y plane of the beam coordinate system.

field.name: BeamElevationBeamwidth
field.semantics: The full width of the beam to the -3 dB power density points in the x-z plane of the beam coordinate system.

field.name: ReferenceSystem
field.semantics: The reference coordinate system with respect to which beam direction is specified

field.name: Ez
field.semantics: The magnitude of the Z-component (in beam coordinates) of the Electrical field at some arbitrary single point in the mainbeam and in the far field of the antenna.

field.name: Ex
field.semantics: The magnitude of the X-component (in beam coordinates) of the Electrical field at some arbitrary single point in the mainbeam and in the far field of the antenna

field.name: BeamPhaseAngle
field.semantics: The phase angle between Ez and Ex in radians.

fixedRecordData.name: RadioTypeStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Specifies the type of a radio.

field.name: EntityKind
field.semantics: The kind of the entity described in this struct.

field.name: Domain
field.semantics: The domain in which the radio entity operates.

field.name: CountryCode
field.semantics: The country to which the design of the radio entity is attributed.

field.name: Category
field.semantics: The main category that describes the radio entity.

field.name: NomenclatureVersion
field.semantics: The specific modification or individual unit type for a series and/or family of equipment.

field.name: Nomenclature
field.semantics: The nomenclature for a particular communications device.

fixedRecordData.name: SINCGARSModulationStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Modulation parameters for SINCGARS radio system

field.name: FHNetID
field.semantics: Frequency hopping network identifier.

field.name: HopSetID
field.semantics: Identification for the set of frequencies used when creating a hopping pattern.

field.name: LockoutSetID
field.semantics: Identification for the set of frequencies that are excluded from the hopping pattern.

field.name: TransmissionSecurityKey
field.semantics: Identifies the transmission security key that is used when generating the hopping pattern.

field.name: FHSynchronizationTimeOffset
field.semantics: The offset to exercise time in seconds for the clock in the radio.

fixedRecordData.name: SphericalHarmonicAntennaStruct
fixedRecordData.semantics: Specifies the direction and radiation pattern from a radio transmitter's antenna.

field.name: Order
field.semantics: The highest order of the expansion in spherical harmonics, counting from zero.

field.name: Coefficients
field.semantics: Represents the power distribution from the antenna as the coefficients of a spherical harmonic expansion to the order given in the Order field. The length of the array is N^2+2N+1 (N being the Order).

field.name: ReferenceSystem
field.semantics: This field shall specify the reference coordinate system with respect to which beam direction is specified.

field.name: Padding
field.semantics: Padding to 32 bits

variantRecordData.name: AntennaPatternVariantStruct

alternative.name: BeamAntenna
alternative.semantics: Specifies the direction, pattern, and polarization of radiation from a radio transmitter's antenna, represented with respect to a beam coordinate system.

alternative.name: SphericalHarmonicAntenna
alternative.semantics: Specifies the direction and radiation pattern from a radio transmitter's antenna, represented with respect to the world coordinate system or entity coordinate system.

variantRecordData.semantics: Specifies the radiation pattern from the antenna, its orientation in space, and the polarization of the radiation.

variantRecordData.name: RFModulationTypeVariantStruct

alternative.name: AmplitudeModulationType
alternative.semantics: Detailed modulation type for the amplitude major modulation type.

alternative.name: AmplitudeAngleModulationType
alternative.semantics: Detailed modulation type for the amplitude and angle major modulation type.

alternative.name: AngleModulationType
alternative.semantics: Detailed modulation type for the angle major modulation type.

alternative.name: CombinationModulationType
alternative.semantics: Detailed modulation type for the combination major modulation type.

alternative.name: PulseModulationType
alternative.semantics: Detailed modulation type for the pulse major modulation type.

alternative.name: UnmodulatedType
alternative.semantics: Detailed modulation type for the unmodulated major modulation type.

variantRecordData.semantics: Specifies the major modulation type as well as certain detailed information specific to the type.

variantRecordData.name: SpreadSpectrumVariantStruct

alternative.name: SINCGARSModulation
alternative.semantics: Modulation parameters for SINCGARS radio system.

variantRecordData.semantics: Identifies the actual spread spectrum technique in use.

note.label: RPRnoteCommunication1
note.semantics: All padding fields shall be set to the value 0.

note.label: RPRnoteCommunication2
note.semantics: This must reference a valid Object instance.

note.label: RPRnoteCommunication3
note.semantics: All the fields in the radio type struct are enumerations. The values for the individual fields (that do not use enumeration datatypes from within the RPR FOM) are to be derived from the federation agreements, which could refer to SISO-REF-010. The values used in this structure should comply with the requirements specified in section 5.2.16 of IEEE 1278.1-1995.

note.label: RPRnoteCommunication4
note.semantics: This attribute is updated if the current value differs from the previously updated value by more than the value specified by the symbolic name (see section 5.1.4 of IEEE 1278.1-1995 for the actual values of the symbolic names)
